heisigComment: * The primitive meaning remains the same: seduce. Just be sure to associate it with a very concrete image.
heisigStory: A sword or dagger posed over a mouth is how the character for "beckoning" is written. The related but less tame key word seduce was chosen because it seemed to fit better with the - how shall we put it? - Freudian implications of the kanji. (Observe if you will that it is not sure whether the long slender object is seducing the small round one or vice versa.)
koohiiStory1: A man is easily seduced by a mouth to his "sword.".
koohiiStory2: To seduce is to make a sword of one´s mouth.
words:
召す(めす): to call, to send for, to put on, to wear, to take (a bath), to ride in, to buy, to eat, to drink, to catch (a cold)
召し上がる(めしあがる): eat (polite)
